Posts.Content: Hi Beedeb, like your mum I got dreadful indigestion with my course of FEC, I contacted my GP who prescribed a course of medication I'd been on previously which didn't work for me, so I spoke to BCN who prescribed Omeprazole which helped. Once the BCN had prescribed it I was able to get it from my GP, I still take it as I still have some residual indigestion.   I hope this helps.  Best wishes, Laura x
Posts.Title: Mum has started chemo...

Posts.Content: Hi Concepta, of course we remember you, so glad to hear you are getting through your chemos I'm sure you can't wait for the 20th July, it won't be long now. The chemo suite I went to and also the Radiotherapy suite had hand bells for us to ring, why don't you buy a handbell or bring one in with you on your last chemo day and ring that bell loud and clear.  Very best wishes Laura x
Posts.Title: A Bell To Ring

Posts.Content: Hi Concepta, weeblemum got it right you will have steroids for a couple of days before your chemo and for a day or so after, some people found they got a ‘steroid rush’ eg. cleaning everything in sight , and then a crash after. I didn’t but it seemed to happen to quite a few.  Also be careful you may have shortness of breath as well.  I hope everything goes well for you.  Laura
